titleStmt.title: Twelve humble proposals to the supreme governours of the three nations now assembled at Westminster, concerning the propogation of the gospel, new modling of the Universities, reformation of the laws, supply of the necessities of the poor and many other things of great moment, which may conduce to the honour of God, and the comfort and joy of his people. By M.R. an admirer and adorer of the good providence of God, in making such happy changes in these nations.
titleStmt.author: M. R.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Henry Hills, for R.C. and are to be sold by Giles Calvert, at the Black-spread Eagle, at the west-end of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: The words "propogation ... of the poor" are gathered in a left brace.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C..

place.placeName: the Black-spread Eagle, at the west-end of Pauls
